intro: Coryzadenia trifoliata, commonly known as the three-leaved coryzadenia, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, white to pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters, typically during the spring and early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
